content.question: Diffusion of responsibility has been used to explain which of the following findings in social psychology?

choices.label: People in a group lose their individual identity and become more cohesive.
A person who is alone while witnessing an emergency is more likely to help than if he were part of a group.
People often perform better when working in a group than when working alone.
Many participants obey a researcher even if the researcherâ€™s instructions might lead to harm for another participant.

content.answer: A person who is alone while witnessing an emergency is more likely to help than if he were part of a group.
